Hey, you: Get a load of this cloud! High-altitude ice clouds (like this one) can help regulate Earth's temperature by reflecting energy from the Sun.

A new 
@NASAEarth
 mission called PoISIR aims to study them in greater detail to improve climate forecasts. https://go.nasa.gov/3IAfgjj

14 years ago, 
@Astro_Mike
 wrote the first tweet from space. Since then, we’ve been sharing snippets of our life in orbit—and what it’s like to gaze upon our home planet.

Follow along: http://nasa.gov/astronauts/biographies/active…

Tale as old as time. 

Unusual asteroid Phaethon behaves like a comet. It brightens and forms a tail as it nears the Sun and is the source of a meteor shower, something usually led by comets. But this asteroid's tail tells a different story:
https://go.nasa.gov/3LHmtQs
TROPICS Launch Update!

Looking for the latest news from low Earth orbit?

Follow @NASASpaceOps for mission leadership updates as we live and work beyond our home planet.

This week at NASA, astronauts prepped the @Space_Station for more solar arrays, @NASAHubble celebrated its 33rd anniversary with a new image of a dark nebula, and @VP and @President_KR visited @NASAGoddard.

Astronauts Steve Bowen and @Astro_Alneyadi concluded today’s seven-hour spacewalk at 4:12 p.m. ET (20:12 UTC). It was the eighth for Bowen and the first for any UAE astronaut: https://go.nasa.gov/3ADIeuf

Live: TROPICS experts discuss the mission, which aims to improve understanding of tropical cyclones through regular measurements of precipitation, temperature & humidity.
 
Use #AskNASA and your questions may get answered on air.

Today's spacewalk is officially underway! The two astronauts have switched their spacesuits to battery power. Steve Bowen of @NASA_Astronauts and @Astro_Alneyadi will route power cables to prepare for future power system upgrades outside the @Space_Station.
On Friday, April 21, @NorthropGrumman's uncrewed Cygnus cargo craft is scheduled to depart the @Space_Station. Live coverage begins at 7am ET (1100 UTC). More info: https://go.nasa.gov/3UObN5r
Two cosmonauts are about to venture outside the @Space_Station for a six-and-a-half-hour spacewalk. Live coverage begins at 9pm ET (0100 UTC April 19) on https://go.nasa.gov/3Lc1mFI.

To help defend Earth from potentially hazardous asteroids and comets, we developed the #PlanetaryDefense Strategy & Action Plan. We’re eager to work with @WHOSTP in implementing it. https://go.nasa.gov/3mI3MlZ

Note: There are no known asteroid impact threats for 100+ years.

NASA astronaut Steve Bowen and UAE astronaut @Astro_Alneyadi will step outside the @Space_Station on Friday, April 28, to prepare for new solar arrays that will boost the station's power capacity.

Tune in Monday, April 24, for a live spacewalk preview: https://go.nasa.gov/3KJ8isB

LIVE: Deputy Administrator @Astro_Pam delivers a plenary address at #38Space discussing progress towards a blueprint for sustained human exploration of the Moon and beyond with @NASAArtemis. https://bit.ly/3GQNi1S

Whistles. Crunches. Whooshes.

These are a few of the space sounds heard in a new citizen science project called HARP.
By participating, you can investigate cosmic vibrations recorded by NASA spacecraft that help sing the song of the Sun and Earth.

More: http://go.nasa.gov/3mDXm7o

Shine bright like a ULIRG 

With the light of a trillion suns, an ultra-luminous infrared galaxy (ULIRG) shines in the latest @NASAWebb image. Located 250 million light-years away, this target is actually the result of two colliding spiral galaxies: https://go.nasa.gov/3L7dojN

April 19, 4pm ET (2000 UTC) NASA leaders discuss "Moon to Mars" strategy

The Soyuz MS-23 crew ship with three Exp 69 crewmates aboard docked to the Prichal docking module at 5:22am ET today completing a 37-minute relocation maneuver. More... https://go.nasa.gov/3nPnhcF

Astronauts need spacesuits for different occasions: life and work inside a spacecraft, spacewalks, and one day, planetary walks. In this episode of the Curious Universe podcast, we explore spacesuit design and creation, from fittings to new features: https://go.nasa.gov/3zxE6LK
